options.a: The future worth of a present amount
options.b: A series of uniform amounts over a period of time
options.c: The present worth of a future amount
options.d: An annual repayment of a loan

question: 112. When using net present worth calculations to compare two projects, which of the following could invalidate the calculation?

options.a: Use the same discount rate for each period
options.b: Differences in the magnitudes of the projects

question: 113. Which of the following situations has a conventional cash flow so that an internal rate of return can be safely calculated and used?

options.a: Your company undertakes a mining project in which the land must be reclaimed at the end of the project.
options.b: You invest in a safe dividend stock and receive dividends each year.
options.c: You lease a car and pay by the month.
options.d: Your company invest heavily in a new product that will generates profit for two years. To keep profits high for 10 years, the company plans to reinvest heavily after two.

question: 114. Which of the following elements and compounds is unstable in its pure form?
116. Which one of the following statements regarding organic substances is false?

options.a: Organic matter is generally stable at very high temperature
options.b: Organic substances generally dissolve in high-concentration acids
options.d: Organic substances generally do not dissolve in water.

question: 117. Which of the following affects most of the electrical and thermal properties of materials?

options.c: The electrons, particularly the outermost one
options.d: The magnitude of electrical charge of the protons

question: 119. How do you call the strong bond between hydrogen atoms?
120. What are Van der Waals forces?
122. What do you call the replacement of the original cost of an investment?
123. Adding more solute to an already saturated solution will cause the excess solute to settle to the bottom of the container. What is this process called?
124. The length of time at which the original cost of capital used to purchase a unit has already been recovered?
128. When two sellers control sufficient of the supply of a commodity or service to control its price is known as?
129. The ratio of total liabilities to total assets is said to be?
131. In a thermodynamics process following, $PV^n = C$, what is the process if the value of n is infinity?
133. A demand that occurs when a decrease in selling price produces little or no effect in sales?
134. An interest computed on the basis of 12 months of 30 days each or 360 days a year, and one interest period is equal to 360 days?
135. What must two investments with the same present worth and unequal lives have?

options.a: Identical equivalent uniform annual cash flow
options.c: Different equivalent uniform annual cash flows

question: Which of the following corresponds to the meaning of annuity?

options.a: A lump sum at the end of the year
options.b: An annual repayment of the loan
options.c: A series of uniform amounts over a period of time
options.d: The future worth of a present amount

correct_answer_text: A series of uniform amounts over a period of time

question: The ability to convert assets to cash quickly is known as \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_.
